Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Megin 1 (natural AMPs; toad, amphibians, animals, XXU, 1S=S, UCSS1a; XXA)
Sequence Information.Source: skin venoms, spadefoot toad,Megophrys minor, Asia.

Literature Information.Literature: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of THE PEPTIDE shows 55% similarity toRanacyclin-B-AL1.Activity:  Active against E. coli ATCC25922 (MIC 25 ug/ml), B. dysenteriae (MIC 3 ug/ml), S. aureus ATCC2592 (MIC 6.25 ug/ml), B. subtilis ATCC 6633 (MIC 3 ug/ml), and C. albicans ATCC2002 (MIC 50 ug/ml).Toxicity: at 200 ug/ml, it caused 29.5% hemolysis of hRBC and 32.9% rabbit RBC. Less hemolytic. Updated 5/2019; 6/2020; 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Yang HL, Shen ZQ, Liu X, Kong Y.2016
Literature Information.Title: Two novel antimicrobial peptides from skin venoms of spadefoot toad Megophrys minor.
